values: Living gluten free is not always easy...but for my husband and four boys, it is always worth it.  There are times when eating gluten may sound 'okay' for a split second, we know that even a molecule of gluten is harmful.  So, we do not bother with gluten at all, ever. Sometimes it feels like I am a broken record about what our family does and does not eat.  That was one good thing about my book that I coauthored, The Gluten-Free Way:  My Way.  It allowed me to put into words, on paper, what we eat and what we do not.  It also allowed me to share some of my favorite recipes with others. I do know that my husband's health is far better being off of the gluten.  My two oldest boys are healthy off of the gluten.  My two youngest boys have never had gluten on purpose.  When they have gotten it by accident, we know right away.  I am thankful that I figured out that gluten was the issue when my oldest was young.  I would not want to go through the two years of my oldest with the next three boys. I am continuing to work on my gluten free recipes.  I love experimenting and figuring out new gluten free flour ratios to use in my baked goods recipes. I love talking about living gluten free.  Please send me a message or comment.

I got a book contract in March 2009 to write a book on the Gluten-Free lifestyle.

It's written!

It's at the publishers!!

It will (hopefully) be on store shelves before Christmas!!!

To learn more about the book, please visit http://www.theglutenfreewaymyway.com.

To learn more about the Gluten-Free lifestyle while waiting to read my book, please visit my personal Gluten-Free blog at http://mygf-life.com.
